show.title: Gremlins 2: The New Batch
show.headline: The most joyful monster bash of 1990

event.title: <show-title>Gremlins 2: The New Batch</show-title>
event.headline: The most joyful monster bash of 1990
event.description: No one’s denying that the original GREMLINS is a top-notch holiday monster movie…but I gotta say: GREMLINS 2 takes the Christmas cake and splatters it against the wall. Dante’s long-awaited sequel revives all the man-trampling insanity of the first film, multiplies it by 10,000 and sprinkles it with glowing chunks of sheer chaos. Mogwai-lovin’ gremlin-wreckers Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, and the great Dick Miller are back, now with a front row seat for the creatures’ takeover of a New York City high-rise. The diminutive terror tornadoes have upgraded to go with their fancy new digs, among them a giant tarantula beast, a bookish intellectual, an electricity creature and many, many, MANY more. Terror legend Christopher Lee is on hand to drop some mad science on the wee maniacs, but nothing can slow their absolute ascent into the annals of anarchistic madcappery!

show.title: Twilight (2008)
show.headline: When you can live forever, what do you live for?

event.title: <show-title>Twilight (2008)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say the name of this impossibly fun & interactive screening out loud…Movie Party
event.description:
You better hold on tight, spider monkey, because we’ve got an interactive screening for you that shines brighter than Edward’s skin on a sunny day.

While that might be the skin of a killer, it’s the face that launched a thousand fans, and we’re bringing as many as we can together for our TWILIGHT Movie Party. Not only will it feature Edward’s steely charisma and maybe the best baseball scene ever put to film, it’ll have themed props like blood vials (mini ketchup bottles), TITSOAK sunglasses to let everyone know that you have the skin of a killer, and an apple stress ball – just don't drop the forbidden fruit unless a vampire is around to catch it).

So start working on your tan, book a flight to Forks, and join us for a night of bloodthirsty fun you’ll remember for the next 100 years of being 17.

show.title: Night Patrol
show.headline: A cop uncovers a secret that puts the residents of his neighborhood in danger

show.title: Steel Magnolias
show.headline: Big hair, big laughs, and a few tears

event.title: <show-title>Steel Magnolias</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: It takes effort to party like this
event.description:
Join us for a trip to the best place on Earth, home of big hair and even bigger gossip: Truvy's Beauty Spot.

In this charming little parlor, you don't just get your hair and nails did – you get vital life lessons, like the fact that there's no such thing as natural beauty. Thanks, Truvy Jones (Dolly Parton)! Then there's Clairee Belcher (Olympia Dukakis), reminding you that the only thing that separates us from the animals is our ability to accessorize. And without Ouiser Boudreaux (Shirley MacLaine), how would you discover that it's possible to be in a bad mood for 40 years?

So tease up your hair, grab your bestie, and join us for this special interactive screening of STEEL MAGNOLIAS, featuring fun surprises like tissues, an armadillo keychain, haircaps, and a sticker featuring Ouiser Boudreaux. You’ll laugh, cry, and quote along with the fiercest females in the South. It'll be even better than a slice of armadillo cake.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1
show.headline: Forever is only the beginning

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

posterImages.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 1

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 1</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Bella's pregnant – help us throw her a movie party baby shower
event.description:
Our TWILIGHT SAGA Movie Party Saga is nearly over with the first chapter of its epic conclusion – BREAKING DAWN PART 1.

Bella has finally chosen between Team Edward and Team Jacob, and after a blending of the vamp and human families, it’s off to the isle of Esme for a honeymoon. Unfortunately, their bliss is short-lived when Bella gets knocked up with a half-vamp, rapidly growing baby – and you thought you were done with newborns after ECLIPSE. Join us as we celebrate the happy couple on their creepy little bundle of joy with themed props like styrofoam cups perfect for that tasty blood babies crave, red glasses that let you look through the eyes of a vampire, and a bridal comb so you have something old and something blue for the wedding.

No measure of time partying with you is enough, but we’ll take all we can get, so book those tickets ASAP. If you don’t, the treaty is totally void, at least in Sam’s mind (that guy can be a real stickler).

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2
show.headline: The epic finale that will live forever

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

posterImages.altText: THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN - PART 2

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn - Part 2</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: We've seen your future – it involves you having a blast at this epic movie party
event.description:
After all this time, we finally understand why we’ve been so obsessed with TWILIGHT SAGA Movie Parties. It was this one, BREAKING DAWN PART 2…we imprinted on it and want you to too! It’s a wolf thing, we have no control over it, but that doesn’t mean we can’t still have fun.

The epic conclusion to TWILIGHT sees newly vamped Bella the proud mom of a creepy, rapidly growing, werewolf-imprinted, half-vampire/half-human baby with a totally normal name. The Volturi aren’t too happy about that so the Cullens and their allies will have to prepare for an all-out decapitation fest. Prepare for the final battle with some magnifico-themed props, including some tiny hands that can feel into your mind and a pen and notebook so you can take notes on how to act human.

No one has loved a Movie Party series as much as we love this one (with one exception). We thought it would last forever but forever isn’t as long as we’d hoped, so be sure to book your seats while they last.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
show.headline: It all begins...with a choice

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Eclipse</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Do us an extraordinary honor and say yes to this interactive screening
event.description:
Every choice has its consequences, some more than others. For example, if you choose to join us for another interactive TWILIGHT screening, the consequence will be you having an incredible time at the movies.

We’re back for another Movie Party in the perpetually cloudy town of Forks, and we think this one will eclipse all the rest. Edward’s back in town and Bella has a few big decisions to make. Will she go for the muscled-up werewolf she’s known since they were kids, or the immortal 17-year-old asking for her hand in marriage? Either way, we’ve got some themed props that you’re sure to imprint on, including custom-packaged hand warmers (in case you need to hide out on a snowy mountain), a glitter temporary tattoo, a graduation tassel, and Bella’s engagement ring (note: it will be a slightly less valuable recreation).

So book those seats before all the shows get filled with armies of newborns – we promise we won’t steal your reason for existing.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
show.headline: The next chapter begins

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: New Moon</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Say hello to Jacob's biceps in this lovesick interactive screening
event.description:
No need to throw yourself off a cliff hoping to get a glimpse of Movie Party fun, because we’re back from Italy with another interactive TWILIGHT screening.

It’s a whole NEW MOON this time around. Edward’s gone, Jacob hit puberty in a big way, and Bella has a serious case of separation anxiety. The only thing that hasn’t changed is how much fun you’ll have. You give us everything we need just by breathing, but we’re giving all of you some themed gifts like a La Push bumper sticker as a keepsake to remember where you've been, mini desk calendars, and custom bandaids. Be sure to keep that last one handy for papercuts at family gatherings.

So whether you’re Team Edward or Team Jacob, hop on your motorcycle and join us for another adventure in Forks that’s...kind of beautiful.

show.title: My Own Private Idaho
show.headline: A queer romance on the fringes

posterImages.altText: MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO sp poster

event.title: <show-title>My Own Private Idaho</show-title>
event.headline: Reeves and Phoenix in Gus Van Sant’s ode to Shakespeare and queer limerence
event.description:
“I love you, and you don’t pay me.”

Queer longing is an expansive, meandering, and maddening thing. It’s often difficult to pinpoint the beginning of a crush or why exactly a desire erupts from a space where nothing existed before. Sometimes it’s as simple as “you make this all feel a little less bad,” and we can call that love or infatuation, but any label doesn’t make the feeling any less real. In Gus Van Sant’s third film, MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO, the writer/director combines multiple scripts, a short story, and a handful of source materials into a kaleidoscopic exploration of queerness, youth, and loneliness. Narcoleptic sex worker Mike Waters (River Phoenix) spends his days hustling in the Pacific Northwest with his closest friend, Scott Favor (Keanu Reeves). Mike nurses a destabilizing affection for Scott and a difficult relationship with his father (James Russo). At the same time, Scott attempts to reject his privileged background in favor of slumming with street hustlers and their eccentric mentor, Pigeon Bob (William Richert). When an opportunity arises to locate Mike’s estranged mother, he embarks on a journey of self-discovery with Scott across the United States and Europe. Non-linear, variegated, and heartfelt, MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO is the transitional intersection of Van Sant’s arthouse stylistic roots and his future commercial successes with TO DIE FOR and GOOD WILL HUNTING. Filled to the brim with dreamy queer disillusionment and featuring iconic performances from the late River Phoenix and everyone’s favorite hunk Keanu Reeves, MY OWN PRIVATE IDAHO is the perfect film to launch the 2026 season of Queer Film Theory 101.

DCP courtesy of Warner Bros.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Tenebre
show.headline: Dario Argento's nervy, meta-textual whodunit

event.title: <show-title>Tenebre</show-title>
event.headline: Argento's seminal Giallo, newly restored
event.description:
After cracking skulls and souls with the supernatural one-two punch of SUSPIRIA and INFERNO, Dario Argento went back to basics with TENEBRE – a brilliant Giallo and one of the filmmaker’s most assured achievements. The story follows a famous horror novelist who, while promoting his latest book in Rome, finds himself at odds with a black-gloved lunatic on a mutilation spree. With stylized comic book visuals, a killer synth score from members of Goblin, and a pre-SCREAM, meta-enhanced exploration of violence, there’s no reason to think about anything except how amazing it feels to be smitten with this movie.

Screening the restoration in English

show.title: The Cat
show.headline: A cosmic rampager from Hong Kong

event.title: <show-title>The Cat</show-title>
event.headline: A cosmic rampager from Hong Kong.
event.description:
Screening the restoration in Cantonese with English subtitles.

This is what happens when a cat saves the planet from an extraterrestrial demon. Blasting from the subconscious of director Ngai Choi Lam (RIKI-OH: THE STORY OF RICKY), THE CAT is one of the most ambitious, inscrutable, and mind-blowing horror movies to ever escape from Hong Kong. Featuring an overdose of acid-drenched creature effects, stop motion hallucinations, and the greatest cat-vs-dog fight ever committed to film, this movie will undoubtedly change everything you thought you knew about cats from outer space. Strap in.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: White of the Eye
show.headline: The only difference between a hunter and a killer... is his prey

event.title: <show-title>White of the Eye</show-title>
event.headline: A psychotronic heater from one of the minds behind PERFORMANCE & DON'T LOOK NOW.
event.description:
Celebrated, complicated and fractured auteur Donald Cammell (PERFORMANCE, DEMON SEED) only made a handful of films in his lifetime, and they’re all fodder for cinephiles to endlessly turn over and reconsider like a Rubik’s Cube. Cammell’s lone Eighties film WHITE OF THE EYE is a high-gloss, Arizona-lensed giallo that’s unreal and unbelievable from start to finish, and wouldn’t be out of place in Argento’s later filmography. David Keith (FIRESTARTER) and Cathy Moriarty (RAGING BULL) star as a serial killer and his unknowing wife…but plot here takes a backseat to Cammell’s expansive stylization and elliptical, hallucinatory editing as well as Pink Floyd-ite Nick Mason’s wild music score. Like Antonioni, Wenders and Jacques Demy before him, Cammell’s European take on the American southwest through his unflinching eye is what’s truly important here.

DCP courtesy of Shout! Factory and the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time (1983)
show.headline: A fantasy adventure from the director of HOUSE!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Hero girl who leapt through time

portraitHeroImage.altText: Hero girl who leapt through time

posterImages.altText: Poster girl who leapt through time

event.title: <show-title>The Girl Who Leapt Through Time (1983)</show-title>
event.headline: A fantasy adventure from the director of HOUSE!
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

After his great success with HOUSE at Toho, legendary filmmaker Nobuhiko Obayashi was given the notoriety to start dabbling in the mainstream. His adaptation of the electrifyingly popular 1967 Japanese novel THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME was the first adaptation of Yasutaka Tsutsi’s book, and was the second highest grossing Japanese film in its release year of 1983. After breaking a beaker at school that releases a lavender-like scent causing student Yoshiyama Kazuko to faint, she wakes up the following morning with the ability to travel through time. Sentimental and sweepingly romantic, THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME is part of Obayashi’s Onomichi trilogy, which include coming of age sci-fi films set in the town of his birth. The trilogy also includes I ARE YOU, YOU ARE ME and LONELY HEART.

DCP courtesy of Cult Epics and the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: Twin Peaks
show.headline: FBI Agent Dale Cooper investigates the murder of Laura Palmer

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks</show-title> <event-type-title>Episodes 7-9</event-type-title>
event.description:
Episode 7: "Realization Time" | 46 mins.
Cooper and the Bookhouse Boys raid One Eyed Jacks. Donna, James, and Maddy plan to retrieve Laura's secret diary.

Episode 8: "The Last Evening" | 47 mins.
A violent confrontation occurs as the season comes to a close. Cooper is shot by a masked assailant, and Leo attacks Shelly.

Episode 9: "May the Giant Be with You" | 94 mins.
Cooper receives a cryptic message from a giant. Donna gets involved with Harold Smith, and Leland's hair turns white.

portraitHeroImage.altText: TWIN PEAKS TV The Last Evening hero copy

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Twin Peaks
show.headline: FBI Agent Dale Cooper investigates the murder of Laura Palmer

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks</show-title> <event-type-title>Episodes 10-13</event-type-title>
event.description:
Episode 10: "Coma" | 47 mins.
Donna meets Harold Smith, a friend of Laura's. Cooper receives more cryptic clues, and Maddy has a vision of Bob.

Episode 11: "The Man Behind Glass" | 47 mins.
Albert returns to Twin Peaks with new evidence. Harold shows Donna Laura's secret diary, and Ben and Jerry discuss a new business deal.

Episode 12: "Laura's Secret Diary" | 47 mins.
Maddy receives a mysterious message from Harold. Cooper and Truman question Jacoby, and Lucy reveals she's pregnant.

Episode 13: "The Orchid's Curse" | 47 mins.
Cooper and Truman rescue Audrey from One Eyed Jacks. Leland's behavior becomes increasingly erratic, and Donna and Maddy plot to steal Laura's diary.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Twin Peaks
show.headline: FBI Agent Dale Cooper investigates the murder of Laura Palmer

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks</show-title> <event-type-title>Episodes 14-17</event-type-title>
event.description:
Episode 14: "Demons" | 47 mins.
Cooper receives a message from Windom Earle. Maddy is attacked by Bob, and Donna learns more about Harold.

Episode 15: "Lonely Souls" | 47 mins.
The identity of Laura's killer is revealed as Leland murders Maddy. Cooper and Truman investigate the Log Lady's cabin.

Episode 16: "Drive with a Dead Girl" | 47 mins.
Leland's actions become increasingly erratic. Cooper becomes suspicious of Ben Horne, and Lucy discusses her pregnancy with Andy and Dick.

Episode 17: "Arbitrary Law" | 47 mins.
Cooper and Truman confront Laura's killer, Leland, who dies in custody. The town mourns the loss of Maddy and Leland.

show.title: Twin Peaks
show.headline: FBI Agent Dale Cooper investigates the murder of Laura Palmer

event.title: <show-title>Twin Peaks</show-title> <event-type-title>Episodes 4-6</event-type-title>
event.description:
Episode 4: "Rest in Pain" | 46 mins.
Laura Palmer's funeral brings emotions to the surface. Dr. Jacoby reveals he was in love with Laura, and Cooper interrogates Bobby and Mike.

Episode 5: "The One-Armed Man" | 46 mins.
Cooper and Truman track down the one-armed man, Phillip Gerard. Audrey begins working undercover at her father's department store.

Episode 6: "Cooper's Dream" | 47 mins.
Cooper and Truman find a crime scene in the woods, linked to Jacques Renault. Audrey discovers more about One Eyed Jacks.

show.title: Birdemic: Shock and Terror
show.headline: Mutated birds attack environmentally-unfriendly Californians

event.title: <show-title>Birdemic: Shock and Terror</show-title>
event.headline: James Nguyen's lo-fi disaster epic.
event.description: The most discussed and analyzed avian disaster film since THE BIRDS, BIRDEMIC is a tender love story, a graphic horror shocker, and an urgent ecological warning. Over five years, James Nguyen—the self-proclaimed “Master of the Romantic Thriller™"—crafted the story of a model (Whitney Moore) and software salesman (Alan Bagh) who take a weekend getaway in a quaint California town. But when the city is attacked by homicidal CGI birds, the picturesque paradise becomes a winged hell on earth. Can mankind survive the onslaught? A testament to Nguyen’s enduring vision, BIRDEMIC is an otherworldly midnight movie sensation.

show.title: JEOPARDY! INTERACTIVE
show.headline: America’s Favorite Quiz Show® is headed to the big screen

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: For all ages shows, we welcome babies and kids of all ages. The no talking rules are relaxed, since kids will be kids. But other than that, you can expect the full Alamo experience.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
